com.google.android.exoplayer

Class TrackRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer.TrackRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExoPlayer.ExoPlayerComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyTrackRenderer, SampleSourceTrackRenderer

    public abstract class TrackRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExoPlayer.ExoPlayerComponent
    Renders a single component of media.

    Internally, a renderer's lifecycle is managed by the owning ExoPlayer. The player will transition its renderers through various states as the overall playback state changes. The valid state transitions are shown below, annotated with the methods that are invoked during each transition.

      • MATCH_LONGEST_US

        public static final long MATCH_LONGEST_US
        Represents a time or duration that should match the duration of the longest track whose duration is known. Equal to C.MATCH_LONGEST_US.

        public static final long END_OF_TRACK_US
        Represents the time of the end of the track.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_RELEASED

        protected static final int STATE_RELEASED
        The renderer has been released and should not be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_UNPREPARED

        protected static final int STATE_UNPREPARED
        The renderer has not yet been prepared.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_PREPARED

        protected static final int STATE_PREPARED
        The renderer has completed necessary preparation. Preparation may include, for example, reading the header of a media file to determine the track format and duration.

        The renderer should not hold scarce or expensive system resources (e.g. media decoders) and should not be actively buffering media data when in this state.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_ENABLED

        protected static final int STATE_ENABLED
        The renderer is enabled. It should either be ready to be started, or be actively working towards this state (e.g. a renderer in this state will typically hold any resources that it requires, such as media decoders, and will have buffered or be buffering any media data that is required to start playback).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATE_STARTED

        protected static final int STATE_STARTED
        The renderer is started. Calls to doSomeWork(long, long) should cause the media to be rendered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getMediaClock

        protected MediaClock getMediaClock()
        If the renderer advances its own playback position then this method returns a corresponding MediaClock. If provided, the player will use the returned MediaClock as its source of time during playback. A player may have at most one renderer that returns a MediaClock from this method.
        Returns:
        The MediaClock tracking the playback position of the renderer, or null.

      • getState

        protected final int getState()
        Returns the current state of the renderer.
        Returns:
        The current state (one of the STATE_* constants).

      • doPrepare

        protected abstract boolean doPrepare(long positionUs)
                              throws ExoPlaybackException
        Invoked to make progress when the renderer is in the STATE_UNPREPARED state. This method will be called repeatedly until true is returned.

        This method should return quickly, and should not block if the renderer is currently unable to make any useful progress.

        Parameters:
        positionUs - The player's current playback position.
        Returns:
        True if the renderer is now prepared. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • getTrackCount

        protected abstract int getTrackCount()
        Returns the number of tracks exposed by the renderer.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_PREPARED, STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Returns:
        The number of tracks.

      • getFormat

        protected abstract MediaFormat getFormat(int track)
        Returns the format of the specified track.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_PREPARED, STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Parameters:
        track - The track index.
        Returns:
        The format of the specified track.

      • onEnabled

        protected void onEnabled(int track,
                         long positionUs,
                         boolean joining)
                  throws ExoPlaybackException
        Called when the renderer is enabled.

        The default implementation is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        track - The track for which the renderer is being enabled.
        positionUs - The player's current position.
        joining - Whether this renderer is being enabled to join an ongoing playback.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

        protected void onStarted()
                  throws ExoPlaybackException
        Called when the renderer is started.

        The default implementation is a no-op.

        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • onStopped

        protected void onStopped()
                  throws ExoPlaybackException
        Called when the renderer is stopped.

        The default implementation is a no-op.

        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • onDisabled

        protected void onDisabled()
                   throws ExoPlaybackException
        Called when the renderer is disabled.

        The default implementation is a no-op.

        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • onReleased

        protected void onReleased()
                   throws ExoPlaybackException
        Called when the renderer is released.

        The default implementation is a no-op.

        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • isEnded

        protected abstract boolean isEnded()
        Whether the renderer is ready for the ExoPlayer instance to transition to ExoPlayer.STATE_ENDED. The player will make this transition as soon as true is returned by all of its TrackRenderers.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Returns:
        Whether the renderer is ready for the player to transition to the ended state.

      • isReady

        protected abstract boolean isReady()
        Whether the renderer is able to immediately render media from the current position.

        If the renderer is in the STATE_STARTED state then returning true indicates that the renderer has everything that it needs to continue playback. Returning false indicates that the player should pause until the renderer is ready.

        If the renderer is in the STATE_ENABLED state then returning true indicates that the renderer is ready for playback to be started. Returning false indicates that it is not.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Returns:
        True if the renderer is ready to render media. False otherwise.

      • doSomeWork

        protected abstract void doSomeWork(long positionUs,
                                   long elapsedRealtimeUs)
                            throws ExoPlaybackException
        Invoked to make progress when the renderer is in the STATE_ENABLED or STATE_STARTED states.

        If the renderer's state is STATE_STARTED, then repeated calls to this method should cause the media track to be rendered. If the state is STATE_ENABLED, then repeated calls should make progress towards getting the renderer into a position where it is ready to render the track.

        This method should return quickly, and should not block if the renderer is currently unable to make any useful progress.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Parameters:
        positionUs - The current media time in microseconds, measured at the start of the current iteration of the rendering loop.
        elapsedRealtimeUs - SystemClock.elapsedRealtime() in microseconds, measured at the start of the current iteration of the rendering loop.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • maybeThrowError

        protected abstract void maybeThrowError()
                                 throws ExoPlaybackException
        Throws an error that's preventing the renderer from making progress or buffering more data at this point in time.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - An error that's preventing the renderer from making progress or buffering more data.

      • getDurationUs

        protected abstract long getDurationUs()
        Returns the duration of the media being rendered.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_PREPARED, STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Returns:
        The duration of the track in microseconds, or MATCH_LONGEST_US if the track's duration should match that of the longest track whose duration is known, or or UNKNOWN_TIME_US if the duration is not known.

      • getBufferedPositionUs

        protected abstract long getBufferedPositionUs()
        Returns an estimate of the absolute position in microseconds up to which data is buffered.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_ENABLED, STATE_STARTED

        Returns:
        An estimate of the absolute position in microseconds up to which data is buffered, or END_OF_TRACK_US if the track is fully buffered, or UNKNOWN_TIME_US if no estimate is available.

      • seekTo

        protected abstract void seekTo(long positionUs)
                        throws ExoPlaybackException
        Seeks to a specified time in the track.

        This method may be called when the renderer is in the following states: STATE_ENABLED

        Parameters:
        positionUs - The desired playback position in microseconds.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurs.

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(int what,
                          java.lang.Object object)
                   throws ExoPlaybackException
        Description copied from interface: ExoPlayer.ExoPlayerComponent
        Handles a message delivered to the component. Invoked on the playback thread.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface ExoPlayer.ExoPlayerComponent
        Parameters:
        what - An integer identifying the type of message.
        object - The message object.
        Throws:
        ExoPlaybackException - If an error occurred whilst handling the message.
